servinfo.title: Common Rail (High Pressure Fuel Injection Rail) Removal and Installation

attention1.ptxt: Before servicing fuel system, be sure to observe Precautions on Fuel System Service:F9Q .

attention2.ptxt: Never remove fuel rail pressure sensor from common rail because this may cause fuel circuit contamination problems.
If fuel rail pressure sensor fails, common rail and all high pressure pipes must be replaced.

s1.ptxt: Remove all high pressure pipes referring to High Pressure Pipe Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Remove oil separator referring to Oil Separator Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Remove common rail (2) from cylinder head.
Install common rail (1) to cylinder head, and tighten common rail bolt by hand.
Install new high pressure pipes referring to High Pressure Pipe Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Install oil separator referring to Oil Separator Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Install fuel injector cover, throttle body and engine cover referring to Step 4) through 8) of “Installation” under High Pressure Pipe Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Check fuel leakage referring to Fuel Leakage Check Procedure:F9Q .
Check DTC referring to DTC Check:F9Q .
